systemPipeShiny 0.99.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

SPS plugin operations

Source: R/spsPlugin.R
spsLoadPlugin.Rd

spsLoadPlugin() is used to load an existing SPS plugin, spsRemovePlugin() is to remove a loaded plugin, and spsNewPlugin() is for developers to create a minimum plugin structure and required files.

spsLoadPlugin(
  plugin = "",
  app_path = getwd(),
  verbose = FALSE,
  third_party = FALSE,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  colorful = TRUE
)

spsRemovePlugin(
  plugin = "",
  app_path = getwd(),
  force = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  colorful = TRUE
)

spsNewPlugin(path, readme = TRUE, verbose = FALSE, colorful = TRUE)

Arguments

plugin

character, a plugin name. It can also be a path in spsLoadPlugin function when if third_party = TRUE.
app_path

the SPS project you want to load plugin to
verbose

bool, show more information?
third_party

bool, is this an official plugin?
overwrite

bool, if there are file conflicts, overwrite current existing files in app_path?
colorful

bool, colorful message?
force

bool, if plugin files found, confirm before remove?
path

character string, path of where you want to create the plugin directory, can be a non-existing location but make sure you have write permission.
readme

bool, created README.md file?

Value

No return

Details

General

  • Make sure there is a 'config/tabs.csv' file in your SPS project when you load the plugin.

  • You can just use spsLoadPlugin() without any argument to see what are the plugin options.

  • If there is any file conflicts when loading plugins, please see the app structure tree and refer to the legend below the tree to help you resolve conflicts. Overwriting current files is not recommended. Rename conflict files and compare them after loading the plugin will be better.

  • When a plugin is removed, only tab files from that plugin are removed and entries on config/tabs.csv are removed. Other files come from the plugin will not be removed.

Building a plugin

  • When adding new tabs to a plugin, it will be better to set working directory to PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app. Tab files should go into PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app/R.

  • Any additional files in PLUGIN_ROOT/inst/app except the config/tabs.csv will also be copied to users' project.

  • Tab files will be checked and two functions in the tab file are expected: tabIDUI and tabIDServer. Other files will not be checked for content.

Examples

# see what official plugins you can install:
spsLoadPlugin()
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Current SPS has following plugins
#> spsBio               Biological plots
#> BiocManager::install("systemPipeR/spsBio")
#> spsDS                A variety of plots for general data analysis
#> remotes::install_github("systemPipeR/spsDS")
# create a project
spsInit(project_name = "testProject",
        change_wd = FALSE,
        open_files = TRUE,
        overwrite = TRUE)
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Start to create a new SPS project
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Create project under /home/lz/Desktop/systemPipeShiny/docs/reference/testProject
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Now copy files
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Create SPS database
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Created SPS database method container
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:51 Creating SPS db...
#> [SPS-DANGER] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Db created at '/home/lz/Desktop/systemPipeShiny/docs/reference/testProject/config/sps.db'. DO NOT share this file with others
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Key md5 e83b4fddf9da843a10a9902b1dfdf586
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 SPS project setup done!
# create a new plugin
spsNewPlugin(path = "testPlugin")
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 testPlugindoes not exist, try to create
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Plugin testPlugin created
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Optional: To format the plugin folder to a more publishable structure, run following
#> usethis::create_package("testPlugin")
# add some tabs to the plugin
# tabs
plugin_path <- file.path("testPlugin", "inst", "app")
newTabData("data_a",
           app_path = plugin_path,
           plugin = "testPlugin",
           reformat = FALSE,
           open_file = FALSE)
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Write to file testPlugin/inst/app/R/tab_vs_data_a.R
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Now register your new tab to config/tab.csv
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 New tab created!
newTabPlot("plot_a",
           app_path = plugin_path,
           plot_data = list(makePlotData(receive_datatab_ids = 'data_a',
                                    app_path = plugin_path)),
           plugin = "testPlugin",
           reformat = FALSE,
           open_file = FALSE)
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Write to file testPlugin/inst/app/R/tab_vs_plot_a.R
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Now register your new tab to config/tab.csv
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 New tab created!
# load the plugin, the plugin is not published, so `third_party = TRUE`
spsLoadPlugin(plugin = "testPlugin",
              app_path = "testProject",
              third_party = TRUE,
              overwrite = F)
#> New directory will be: 
#> +-- deploy.R
#> +-- global.R
#> +-- README.md
#> +-- results
#> |   L-- README.md
#> +-- server.R
#> +-- ui.R
#> +-- www
#> |   +-- about
#> |   |   +-- dcassol.md
#> |   |   +-- gmosher.md
#> |   |   +-- jzhang.md
#> |   |   +-- lzhang.md
#> |   |   +-- pramasamy.md
#> |   |   L-- tgirke.md
#> |   +-- css
#> |   |   L-- sps.css
#> |   +-- img
#> |   |   +-- noimg.png
#> |   |   +-- sps_small.png
#> |   |   +-- sps_wf.png
#> |   |   L-- sps.png
#> |   +-- js
#> |   |   +-- sps_update_pg.js
#> |   |   L-- sps.js
#> |   +-- loading_themes
#> |   |   +-- double-helix.js
#> |   |   +-- LICENSE-particlesjs.md
#> |   |   +-- micro.js1
#> |   |   +-- nyan.css
#> |   |   +-- nyan.html
#> |   |   +-- particles.min.js
#> |   |   +-- vhelix.css
#> |   |   L-- vhelix.html
#> |   L-- plot_list
#> |       +-- plot_bar.png
#> |       +-- plot_pca.png
#> |       +-- plot_point.png
#> |       L-- plot_tsne.jpg
#> +-- config
#> |   +-- README.md
#> |   +-- sps_options.yaml
#> |   +-- sps.db
#> |   L-- tabs.csv
#> +-- data
#> |   +-- config.yaml
#> |   +-- countDFeByg.xls
#> |   +-- DEGcounts.xls
#> |   +-- edgeR_DF.xls
#> |   +-- iris.csv
#> |   +-- README.md
#> |   +-- systemPipeRNAseq.md
#> |   +-- targets.txt
#> |   L-- targetsPE.txt
#> L-- R
#>     +-- README.md
#>     +-- tab_deg.R
#>     +-- tab_eda.R
#>     +-- tab_upload.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_data_count.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_data_degcounts.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_data_edgeR.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_data_targets.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_box.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_clust.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_glm.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_heat.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_mds.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_pca.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_tsne.R
#>     +-- tab_vs_plot_volcano.R
#>     +-- *tab_vs_data_a.R
#>     L-- *tab_vs_plot_a.R
#> -- Old files -- *New files
#> -- **Overlapping files Directory
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Plugin testPlugin added!
# check if the plugin is added
# You should see `tab_vs_data_a.R` and `tab_vs_plot_a.R`
list.files(file.path("testProject", "R"))
#>  [1] "README.md"               "tab_deg.R"              
#>  [3] "tab_eda.R"               "tab_upload.R"           
#>  [5] "tab_vs_data_a.R"         "tab_vs_data_count.R"    
#>  [7] "tab_vs_data_degcounts.R" "tab_vs_data_edgeR.R"    
#>  [9] "tab_vs_data_targets.R"   "tab_vs_plot_a.R"        
#> [11] "tab_vs_plot_box.R"       "tab_vs_plot_clust.R"    
#> [13] "tab_vs_plot_glm.R"       "tab_vs_plot_heat.R"     
#> [15] "tab_vs_plot_mds.R"       "tab_vs_plot_pca.R"      
#> [17] "tab_vs_plot_tsne.R"      "tab_vs_plot_volcano.R"  
# check if tab files are registered
# You should see the two new records
vroom::vroom(file.path("testProject", "config", "tabs.csv"),
             comment = "#") %>% tail()
#> Rows: 27
#> Columns: 8
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr [7]: tab_id, display_label, type, type_sub, image, tab_file_name, plugin
#> dbl [1]: displayed
#> 
#> Use `spec()` to retrieve the guessed column specification
#> Pass a specification to the `col_types` argument to quiet this message
#> # A tibble: 6 x 8
#>   tab_id   display_label  type  type_sub image displayed tab_file_name   plugin 
#>   <chr>    <chr>          <chr> <chr>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr>           <chr>  
#> 1 plot_cl… H-Clust        vs    plot     NA            1 tab_vs_plot_cl… spsBio 
#> 2 plot_vo… Volcano        vs    plot     NA            1 tab_vs_plot_vo… spsBio 
#> 3 data_de… DEG Count data vs    data     NA            1 tab_vs_data_de… spsBio 
#> 4 data_ed… EdgeR data     vs    data     NA            1 tab_vs_data_ed… spsBio 
#> 5 data_a   Data Tab Title vs    data     NA            1 tab_vs_data_a.R testPl…
#> 6 plot_a   Plot Tab Title vs    plot     NA            1 tab_vs_plot_a.R testPl…
# now remove the plugin
spsRemovePlugin(plugin = "testPlugin", app_path = "testProject", force = TRUE)
#> [SPS-INFO] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Matched plugin tab files(s): tab_vs_data_a.R, tab_vs_plot_a.R
#> [SPS-SUCCESS] 2020-09-11 01:18:52 Plugin testPlugin removed!
# let check these files again:
list.files(file.path("testProject", "R"))
#>  [1] "README.md"               "tab_deg.R"              
#>  [3] "tab_eda.R"               "tab_upload.R"           
#>  [5] "tab_vs_data_count.R"     "tab_vs_data_degcounts.R"
#>  [7] "tab_vs_data_edgeR.R"     "tab_vs_data_targets.R"  
#>  [9] "tab_vs_plot_box.R"       "tab_vs_plot_clust.R"    
#> [11] "tab_vs_plot_glm.R"       "tab_vs_plot_heat.R"     
#> [13] "tab_vs_plot_mds.R"       "tab_vs_plot_pca.R"      
#> [15] "tab_vs_plot_tsne.R"      "tab_vs_plot_volcano.R"  
vroom::vroom(file.path("testProject", "config", "tabs.csv"),
             comment = "#") %>% tail()
